result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia E Erickson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patricia E Erickson in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CM18, 15CT2, 14TR4144, 14TR4145

10:34 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CT2 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Atty Cousins states facts. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 15CT2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CT2 -
365 days jai th huber STAYED
Probation for 24 months:
Serve 180 days in jail.  Can serve last 60 days on electronic monitor with a sobrietor so long as she has successfully complied with all the conditions of
probation up until that time. 
3 days credit
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Pay fine and costs totaling  $3,976.00. To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Pay $26.45 blood draw fee.
Revocation 36 months
IID 36 months
AODA and comply with any recommendations for treatment
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain employment 
Comply with any other counseling requirements as determined by agent that are reasonably related to this offense.

14TR4144 is dismissed and read in.
15CM18 dismissed and read-in.

14TR4145 found Guilty and order to pay the forfeiture of $263.50.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Patricia E Erickson in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Bond Reinstated: Defendant to go to the Public Defender once she is released to see if she is eligible for counsel.
Initial appearance on February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

1:17 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.
Atty Cousins states that the defendant failed to appear for her court date on an initial appearance.
Defendant states the reason why she was not here.
Atty Cousins states the bond request on the record.
Defendant states that she does not have any cash to put down on bond and makes additional statements on the record.
Court questions the defendant if she had been in Court on 01/08/15 and she indicated that she had been.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant to be quashed.
Court to reinstate the $1,500.00 Signature Bond.
Defendant to go to the Public Defender once she is released to see if she is eligible for counsel.  
Initial appearance scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
$1,000 cash alternative.  sent to JR. 01-20-15 ss

Defendant Patricia E Erickson not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant doesn't appear today.  BTC: Court finds probable cause.  Arrest Warrant. $1,000 cash alternative.

To be heard at 1:15 p.m. Clerk: EP
DA # 14PT2424
Anticipated: Bail Jump

ADA COusins  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump.  (15CT2) missed scheduled appearances at Day Report and pre-trial supervision program
Court informs defendant of rights
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests additional $1,000  with conditions as stated.   (comply with all conditions in 15CT2)
Defendant makes statement
Cannot post any additional moneys.
Works at Childrens' Discovery Center

BTC:
$1500 sig bond
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.  

Will be represented by Pub. Defender
Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  1-20-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1

Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
